The college timings depend on the year you are studying in. Each year has a different schedule based on subjects and lab sessions. Generally, classes begin in the morning and end by afternoon, but specific timings are provided by your department at the start of every semester.

patterns: Where can I get the admission form?
responses:
Our college has three modes of admission: CET, COMEDK, and Management quota.

*CET (Common Entrance Test):* Conducted by the Karnataka Examination Authority. If youâ€™re familiar with CET, you know it involves ranking, option entry, and seat allotment through the KEA portal.

*COMEDK:* Admission through COMEDK involves appearing for the COMEDK UGET exam, checking your rank, and participating in centralized counseling for seat selection.

*Management Quota:* Students can directly apply under the management category by contacting the admission office for seat availability and fee details. For more details contact XXX

patterns: How much is the tuition fee?

patterns: How do I apply for hostel?
Can I get a single room?
responses: Yes, hostel facilities are available for both boys and girls. Rooms are typically shared (2 or 3 students per room). WiFi, mess, and laundry services are provided. Applications can be submitted under the 'Accommodation' section of the student portal. For more details, please contact the hostel warden. warden's contact detail XXX

patterns: Is the library open on Sunday?
How to get a library card?
responses: The library is open from 8.30 AM to 5.00 PM. It remains closed on Sundays and public holidays. You can borrow books using your student ID.

patterns: Which company offers the highest package?
responses: The placement cell coordinates campus recruitment for companies like Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Accenture and many more companies. The average package is around â‚¹5 LPA. Internship and career guidance are provided by the placement office. For mor details contact placement department - contact: XXX.

patterns: Who is the HOD of computer science?
responses: HOD - Dr. Mustafa Basthikodi.

Yes, the college has a single-floored canteen that is spacious and well-maintained. It serves both vegetarian and non-vegetarian food options, with meals prepared under hygienic conditions to ensure quality and freshness.

The canteen timings are from *8:00 AM to 8.30 PM*, offering breakfast, lunch, snacks, and beverages throughout the day. It is located within the campus and easily accessible to students and staff.

The college conducts several events including technical fests, cultural programs, and sports meets. Upcoming events are announced in the 'Campus Life' section of the official website. Stay tuned for updates from the student council.

patterns: How can I check my results?
responses: Results are published in the 'Examinations' section of the student portal. Log in using your student ID and password. For revaluation or doubts, contact the exam cell.

patterns: Where should I submit my original documents?
Do I need to bring TC and marks card?
What documents are required during admission?
responses: Document verification happens during admission at the college office. Youâ€™ll need your 10th and 12th marks cards, TC, entrance exam scorecard, photos, and ID proof. Originals are required for verification.

patterns: How can I check my admission status?
When will admission confirmation be sent?
responses: You can check your admission status by logging into the college admission portal or contacting the admission office. Confirmation messages are usually sent to your registered email and phone number.

patterns: What is the minimum attendance required?
Can I attend exams with low attendance?
responses: Students must maintain at least *85% attendance* in each subject to be eligible for semester exams. Attendance is tracked daily, and shortfall may result in being barred from exams.

patterns: Where can I find the academic calendar?
What is the duration of each semester?
responses: The academic calendar, including semester start and end dates, exam periods, and holidays, is available on the official college website under the Academics â†’ Calendar section.

patterns: When is the last date to pay fees?
What happens if I donâ€™t pay fees on time?
Can I pay fees after the deadline?
responses: The last date for fee payment is usually announced by the accounts department before each semester. Late payments may incur fines. Itâ€™s best to pay before the due date to avoid penalties.

patterns: Does the college provide fee waiver?
responses: Yes, the college provides scholarships and partial fee waivers for meritorious and economically weaker students. Applications can be made through the scholarship section on the portal or the admin office.

patterns: Iâ€™m facing an issue with online payment
responses: You can pay fees online via the student portal using debit/credit cards, UPI, or net banking. In case of failed transactions, contact the accounts office with your payment reference number.

patterns: How do I register for hostel?
Can I apply for hostel online?
Is hostel admission separate from college admission?
responses: Hostel registration is done after confirming your college admission. You can apply through the Accommodation section on the student portal or directly contact the hostel office.

patterns: Does the college provide a fee waiver?
Can I apply for financial aid?
Is there any support for economically weaker students?
responses: Yes, the college offers various scholarships and fee concessions based on academic performance, government schemes, and financial need. Eligible students can apply through the official scholarship portal or contact the Accounts/Scholarship section in the admin office for guidance.

patterns: Can we stay out late at night?
responses: The hostel maintains strict discipline. Visitors are allowed only during specific hours, and students must return before the *7:00 PM* curfew. Loud music and unauthorized outings are prohibited.

patterns: How can I report a problem in hostel?
My room fan is not working
Who should I contact for repairs?
responses: For any hostel maintenance issues, report to the hostel warden or submit a complaint form at the hostel office. Issues like electricity or plumbing are resolved within 24â€“48 hours.
WiFi is available across the campus. Use your student ID to log in. For any connectivity issues, contact the IT Support Desk located in the admin block.

patterns: Is there a medical room in college?
What if I feel sick in campus?
responses: Yes, the college has a medical room equipped with basic first aid and a visiting doctor. In case of emergencies, immediate assistance is provided by the campus nurse.

patterns: Do you provide career counselling for admissions?
Can I talk to someone before choosing a branch?
Is there counselling for selecting courses?
Who can guide me during admission?
responses: Yes, the college offers admission and career counselling to help students choose the right branch based on their interests and scores. You can meet the counsellor at the Admission Help Desk during office hours.

patterns: Can diploma students join directly in second year?
Is there a lateral entry program?
How can I apply for lateral entry?
responses: Yes, diploma students can apply for lateral entry to the second year of B.E.

patterns: What happens if I fail a subject?
responses: If you fail in a subject, you can appear for supplementary exams conducted by the university. The number of allowed backlogs varies, but clearing them before the final semester is mandatory for graduation.

patterns: How can I apply for revaluation?
Iâ€™m not satisfied with my marks
responses: You can apply for revaluation or photocopy of your answer script through the Examination Cell within 7â€“10 days of result publication. Additional fees apply per subject.

patterns: How long are holidays after exams?
When does the next semester start?
Do we get a vacation between semesters?
responses: Semester breaks usually last 2â€“3 weeks after end-semester exams. The new semester schedule is updated in the academic calendar and shared via circulars.

patterns: Are guests allowed in hostel rooms?
Is there a guest room available?
Where can my relatives stay during visits?
responses: Parents and guardians are not allowed to stay in hostel rooms. However, guest rooms are available on prior request through the hostel office for short stays during admissions or events.

patterns: Can you show me the campus map?
How to find my department building?
responses: You can view the interactive Campus Map on the college website under the â€˜About Us â†’ Campus Layoutâ€™ section. It shows buildings, labs, parking, and other key locations.

patterns: I lost my phone in campus
Where do I report lost items?
responses: Lost items can be reported at the Security Office near the main gate. If found, theyâ€™re stored for a limited period. Always report valuable losses immediately.
Yes, the college has an Alumni Mentorship Program where senior graduates guide students on careers, placements, and higher studies. Join the alumni network via the official website.

patterns: Do you provide mental health support?
Whom to talk to about personal issues?
responses: Yes, the college provides free student counseling and emotional wellness support. You can confidentially meet the counselor by booking an appointment through the student helpdesk.

patterns: Do we get soft skills training?
How to prepare for campus interviews?
responses: Yes, pre-placement training is provided including aptitude, communication, resume building, and interview preparation sessions organized by the Training and Placement Cell.

patterns: Does the college help with GRE or GATE preparation?
Is there guidance for higher studies?
Can I get help applying abroad?
responses: Yes, the college offers seminars and mentoring for students aspiring for GATE, GRE, CAT, and higher studies abroad. Faculty members guide you in selecting universities and preparing applications.

patterns: How can I join a student club?
Are new members allowed in clubs?
responses: Yes, students can join any club by signing up during club registration week or via the online student portal. Clubs like Robotics, Coding, Arts, and Cultural welcome new members every semester.

patterns: Whom to call in case of accident?
responses: In case of emergency, contact the Security Office at extension *222* or the Medical Room at *+91 824 2277333 (Ext. 105)*. Security staff are available 24/7 inside the campus.

patterns: What items are not allowed in exams?
When should I reach the exam hall?
responses: Students must report 15 minutes before the exam. Mobile phones and smart devices are not allowed. Only non-programmable calculators are permitted for technical subjects.
